summary: The Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division (WHD) served as a key recipient of CIA dispatches, memoranda, and reports spanning from the late 1950s to the early 1970s. These documents detail operational activities and personnel matters within the Western Hemisphere, particularly in the Caribbean region and Mexico City. The WHD Chief oversaw a range of topics, including agent handling (recruitment, termination, reassignment, security), covert site approvals, intelligence gathering, and CIA-supported propaganda efforts. Specific operations mentioned include LIRING-3 and LIENVOY, along with individuals such as Arthur G. Vaivada and William D. Pawley. The Chief's role was primarily supervisory, involving the management and oversight of covert operations and security matters within the division.
